resources.string:
Team
Team 44 consists of 3 members
Romana Nagyova (team leader), studying Mathematical Computation
Mengyang Wu, studying Computer Science
Vlad Popa, studying Computer Science
All of us are in first year of University College London.

Client\nOur client Stuart Ross is from UCL Speech, Hearing and Phonetic Sciences. In this project, we are developing an Android application providing visual guides with voice for children. The application has a simple game-like format. Its main purpose is to train children to understand speech in noise and improve their concentration.

Project
A set of numbers is displayed, accompanied with an animal of the users choice. Each number is of a different colour. The user needs to identify what number, colour and animal the voice is telling them to click on.
Furthemore, there is a background noise, which makes it challenging to hear the target voice. This is calculated via signal to noise ratio, which increases/decreases directly proportional to right/wrong answers, respectively. Signal to noise ratio will further be referred to as SNR.
The data from result are displayed in a graph, where X axis represents the numbers of trials and Y axis stands for signal to noise ratio. Results are stored in server and sent to both our client and the user.
\nSet your email address here for receiving results\n
